results.text: Come to me, all you who are weary and burdened, and I will give you rest.
results.reason: Jesus invites the tired to find rest in Him.
results.reflection: In our weariness, Jesus offers us true rest for our souls.

results.text: but those who hope in the Lord will renew their strength. They will soar on wings like eagles; they will run and not grow weary, they will walk and not be faint.
results.reason: Finding strength and renewal in the Lord.
results.reflection: When we put our hope in God, He renews our strength to overcome weariness.

results.text: The Lord is my shepherd, I lack nothing. He makes me lie down in green pastures, he leads me beside quiet waters, he refreshes my soul. He guides me along the right paths for his nameâ€™s sake.
results.reason: God as our shepherd provides rest and refreshment.
results.reflection: In God, we find the rest and restoration our tired souls desperately need.

results.text: Let us not become weary in doing good, for at the proper time we will reap a harvest if we do not give up.
results.reason: Encouragement to persevere and not grow weary.
results.reflection: Even when we are tired, let us continue to do good, knowing that God will bring about a harvest in due time.

results.text: Therefore we do not lose heart. Though outwardly we are wasting away, yet inwardly we are being renewed day by day.
results.reason: Finding inner renewal despite physical tiredness.
results.reflection: Our physical tiredness is temporary, but God's renewal of our inner selves is constant and eternal.
